settings.title: Omega-3 is key during pregnancy.
settings.text: Pregnant women consuming long chain omega-3 fatty acids such as found in seafood, fish oil and algal oil can reduce the earliest and most risky preterm births by 42%, according to the Cochrane Review (2018). Pregnant women should try to achieve a DHA intake of around 500 mg/day during pregnancy. Women who don’t consume enough seafood, can receive DHA from prenatal supplements that contain DHA. Most DHA supplements are in a capsular form, however, a powder source that can be added to foods and beverages is now available for women who prefer not to take capsules.
settings.author: Susan Carlson, Ph. D.

settings.name: Julie Sawaya
settings.text: I discovered my passion for nutrition around my family dinner table. My dad (an MD) was diagnosed with diabetes when I was just 5 years old. His illness has had a profound effect on me, leading me to research, experience firsthand, and advocate for the connection between our health, our families and communities, and how we choose to nourish ourselves. My passion for nutrition only grew as I began my journey to motherhood, as the quality of our nourishment as mamas-to-be and new mamas quite literally impacts the health and well being of our entire family.

settings.name: Ryan Woodbury
settings.text: My interest in nutrition and health grew out of my interest in the environment. As a young girl in California, I started volunteering at a local aquarium, leading educational tours to teach kids about marine science and environmental advocacy. It was clear to me, even then, that our health as humans is directly connected to the health of our environment. Advocating for broader awareness of the human and environmental health connection has carried through much of my life. I believe fundamentally that nourishing mamas will directly support nourished communities and a nourished planet.

settings.title: Dr. John Baldeschwieler
settings.description: Professor Baldeschwieler is a J. S. Johnson Professor of Chemistry, Emeritus at California Institute of Technology beginning his tenure there in 1973. He is a National Medal of Science recipient for his public service and scientific contributions, and worked as Deputy Director of the Office of Science and Technology in The White House from 1970-1972.  Professor Baldeschwieler has dedicated his career to the study and applicability of natural delivery systems, namely liposomal technology. While at Caltech, he was responsible for commercializing some of the first and most successful pharmaceutical liposomal applications. He founded Vestar, Inc. and served as the Chairman of its Board of Directors before it merged into NeXstar Pharmaceuticals, Inc. (acquired by Gilead, Inc.). He founded other companies, such as Combion, and served as Director of the Huntington Medical Research Institutes.  He taught at Harvard and Stanford before joining the faculty at Caltech. Professor Baldeschwieler completed his undergraduate studies in Chemical Engineering at Cornell University and earned a Ph.D. in Chemistry from University of California, Berkeley.

settings.title: Jill Castle, M.S. R.D.N
settings.description: First and foremost, Jill Castle is a pediatric nutritionist and childhood nutrition expert. She works with parents to help them best nourish their children with nutritious foods and recipes and effective feeding strategies, establishing healthy habits that last a lifetime. To Needed, Jill is a vital advisor to Needed, helping to inform our educational content for practitioners and consumers, alike.

From identifying common consumer needs to informing product development to helping with ingredient selection, Dr. Leah plays an active role on Needed’s Advisory Board, informing the product pipeline. settings.title: meet our advisors

settings.title: for the fertility-focused woman
settings.text: Omega-3 is critical for overall egg health and hormonal function. It also supports a healthy inflammatory response; reducing excess inflammation could be a crucial component of increasing your fertility.

settings.title: for the pregnant mama-to-be
settings.text: Omega-3 supports baby’s cell growth, baby’s brain and eye development, healthy pregnancy, and mama’s mood.

settings.title: for the postpartum mama
settings.text: Omega-3 is a critical nutrient for a new mama’s recovery, mood, and wellbeing. And it positively influences higher concentration of DHA in breastmilk.

settings.title: From fertility through postpartum
settings.sub_title: Omega-3 is a critical nutrient for fertility, pregnancy, and postpartum health. It’s important to increase Omega-3 intake, as nutrient stores are often depleted during pregnancy because the body will always give preference to the baby’s optimal nourishment.

settings.title: Through nutrient testing, we realized we had serious nutrient deficiencies. Food alone wasn’t meeting our needs.
settings.text: As lifelong nutrition nerds, we were shocked to realize food wasn’t fully meeting our needs. Through nutrient testing, we discovered we were both seriously deficient in Omega-3 and other key nutrients for fertility, pregnancy, and postpartum well-being.

settings.title: We dug into the research and realized we were far from alone. Nearly all women have nutrient deficiencies.
settings.text: Up to 95% of women (even those who are very health conscious) are deficient in Omega-3 and Choline, two of the most critical nutrients for before, during, and after pregnancy. We simply aren’t getting enough of the nutrition we need through food alone.

settings.title: Most prenatal vitamins don’t include all the nutrients a woman needs for optimal nourishment.
settings.text: Most prenatals contain just enough nutrition to prevent birth defects and serious diseases--but fall far short of providing women all that we need for optimal fertility, pregnancies, and postpartum recovery. The critical nutrients Omega-3 DHA + EPA and Choline are lacking from most prenatal vitamins--and even when present, dosages are generally too low to meet a mama’s needs.

settings.title: Prenatal nutrition information is often confusing, incomplete, or just plain wrong.
settings.text: It’s difficult to find trusted, fundamental nutrition information focused on women’s nutrition needs before, during, and after pregnancy. Too often, nutrition information is incomplete, missing important nuances and not considering the whole context of nourishment.

settings.title: We started Needed to meet our needs and that of every mama-to-be.
settings.text: Our mission is to empower women to experience optimal nourishment through better identification of their nutrition needs, supplements that truly work in meeting those needs, and a supportive community of like-minded mamas and trusted health practitioners.

We met as friends, fellow-nutrition nerds, and “someday-to-be” mamas while studying at Stanford’s business school.

Through navigating our own fertility and nutrition journeys, we realized most prenatal nutrition information and products fall far short of empowering real nourishment for mamas-to-be. We’re on a mission to create broader nourishment through better products, information, and community. More about us here.

Yes, Needed is working to expand access to better nutrition products and education to all women.

Through our community give back program, we are committed to donating product to pregnant and breastfeeding women in need, including through partnerships with healthcare clinics focused on serving these women.

Through our research partnership program, we contribute product and monetary support for much-needed nutrition research on fertility, pregnancy, and postpartum health.

We hope to close the gender health research gap that has disadvantaged women for too long.

We are a pending B-Corporation, committed to the highest standards of verified social and environmental performance, public transparency, and legal accountability to balance profit and purpose.

settings.title: Why should I take the quiz?
settings.faq_answer: Whether you are a serious nutrition nerd, or just starting off on your nutrition journey, we believe in empowering our consumers with much-needed information on the fundamentals of nutrition. Our quiz is designed to educate you on the benefits of Omega-3 at every stage of life, and to help you determine the optimal dosage of our Omega-3 Liposomal Powder based on your life stage and other needs.

settings.faq_answer: Together with our practitioner and scientific advisors, we have designed the quiz to deliver educational information on Omega-3, while collecting the right information from you to guide you towards a starting dosage for you and those you are purchasing for. Keep in mind other factors can affect Omega-3 needs and dosage levels, as we discuss in the quiz. While we're always here to help guide you, we recommend consulting with a health practitioner if you have questions about specific health factors that we haven't touched upon.

settings.faq_answer: The only constant in nature is change, and that is the same with our bodies. We recognize that nothing in our world is static, so we recommend you retake the quiz as your life stage or lifestyle evolves.

settings.title: How does Needed select their ingredients?
settings.faq_answer: Nature is nuanced. We pay close attention to nutrient content, and only formulate with ingredients - naturally-derived or lab-produced - that work synergistically with the body. We use lab-synthesized ingredients over naturally-sourced when the quality and purity of natural sources don’t meet our strict standards.

settings.title: From where are Needed's ingredients sourced?
settings.faq_answer: Using the highest quality natural ingredients is important to us, which is why we only source from vendors who meet our quality standards and whose focus is on organic, non-GMO ingredients.

settings.title: Where are your products manufactured?
settings.faq_answer: Our products are proudly manufactured in the USA.

settings.title: How do you ensure that no cross-contamination occurs at the manufacturer?
settings.faq_answer: Our manufacturers perform cGMP-certified sanitation processes that eliminate the trace of allergens between each production batch, ensuring that what you read on our label is exactly what is going into your body. We confirm this through third-party testing.

settings.title: What is Omega-3?
settings.faq_answer:
Omega-3 is critical fat for before, during, and after pregnancy. You cannot make Omega-3, and must obtain it from diet or supplementation. There are three main types of Omega-3, ALA, DHA, and EPA. ALA is found in plants like chia seeds, flax seeds, and walnuts. ALA needs to be converted into the DHA and EPA forms of Omega-3 in order to be used by the body. This conversion process is highly inefficient (often less than 1%), so it is important for mom and baby to consume DHA and EPA directly. Fatty fish and supplements are the two reliable dietary sources. Fish do not make the DHA and EPA, but instead bioaccumulate them from eating algae. 

DHA is used to build and maintain healthy function of cell membranes throughout the body, including those of the brain, eyes, ovaries, and skin. EPA to produce signaling molecules called eicosanoids, which play numerous physiological roles including supporting mood, hormone balance, and reducing inflammation. EPA also improves the transport of DHA across the placenta.

settings.title: What is a liposome and why is it the optimal way to deliver Omega-3?
settings.faq_answer: Liposomes are molecular structures found in nature, such as in breastmilk. Our liposomes pair Omega-3 with natural helper nutrients, including phospholipids from sunflowers. This pairing 1) facilitates near-perfect (90-95%) Omega-3 absorption, a 5x improvement over a standard pill and 2) protects the Omega-3 from harmful oxidation that leads to rancidity. And, as an extra benefit, the phospholipids are a source of choline, which works synergistically with DHA in the body. Overall, liposomes ensure you and your baby to get more of the DHA and EPA you need.

settings.title: How do I know if I need Omega-3?
settings.faq_answer: Our quiz can help. Many are surprised to find that even if they eat a lot of salmon and sardines, their Omega-3 levels are lower than optimal. Research shows that up to 95% of women are deficient. And, even if you are not deficient, the more Omega-3 in your diet the better you will feel.

settings.title: What does the powder taste and smell like?
settings.faq_answer:
The powder tastes like sunflower lecithin, which has a sweet nutty taste. If you are extra sensitive to taste and smell, you may also detect some algae notes. Most find the taste neutral enough to mix into a variety of food and drinks, including almond milk, smoothies, and lattes.

The powder can often smell stronger than it tastes. If that is the case for you, we suggest letting an open packet sit for a minute or two, take a taste, and then mix it into your food or drink.

settings.title: How should I consume the powder?
settings.faq_answer:
Mix one packet into a single serving of food or drink. Enjoy within 1-2 hours of opening the packets. We do not recommend cooking or baking with the powder. For hot food or drink, please mix once the item is cool enough to consume. 


We suggest mixing the powder into lattes, nut butters, salad dressings, and smoothies. Find recipe ideas here.

settings.title: Why is the dosage set at 300mg DHA + 150mg EPA + 55mg choline?
settings.faq_answer:
We set our dosage in partnership with leading scientists and health practitioners across modalities (including MDs, NDs, nutritionists, chinese medicine doctors, midvices, and other birth work professionals) based on research and in-practice experience. Our 300mg of DHA conforms to the American Pregnancy Association per day recommendation. A 2:1 ratio of DHA to EPA allows us to provide multiple benefits for mom and baby, as DHA and EPA have different and often complementary physiological effects. And, as an added benefit to our Omega-3, the powder provides a good source of choline at 55mg. 

We recognize that some practitioners recommend higher dosages of Omega-3 for before, during and after pregnancy. Our clinical research suggests that most mamas and mamas-to-be do not need a higher dose than our product delivers, as our powder facilitates near-perfect (90-95%) Omega-3 absorption, a 5x improvement over a standard pill.

settings.title: What kind of testing do you do?
settings.faq_answer: Our powder is expertly formulated and clinically validated by 10+ years of research and development, including through third-party clinical studies. We test every batch for performance and quality, including through third parties that test for nutritional content, 125+ pesticides and herbicides, heavy metals, microbes, allergens, and other contaminants.

settings.title: Everything makes me nauseous while I am pregnant, will your product work for me?
settings.faq_answer: Many pregnant mamas find our product more pleasant to take than a pill, and can often find something palatable to mix the powder into, even while nauseated. We are happy to share ideas, just shoot us a note at hello@thisisneeded.com. However, do not stress if nothing is working for you in your early pregnancy, as baby draws most of the Omega-3 it needs in the third trimester, so you can pause your subscription and restart once your nausea has passed (soon, we hope!)

settings.title: Why should I start a subscription? How does a subscription work?
settings.faq_answer:
Daily, continuous supplementation is needed to maintain optimal Omega-3 levels for you and your baby before, during, and after pregnancy. Our subscription ensures you never miss a day of optimal nourishment. 

We’ll send you an email each month, a few days before we charge you and ship your next box. You can delay an order, or cancel your subscription at any time, right from your account page. 


Your satisfaction is 100% guaranteed. If you aren’t completely satisfied, send us a note at hello@thisisneeded.com and we’ll be happy to help.

settings.title: Aren’t other nutrients important for mamas and mamas-to-be, why just Omega-3 and choline?
settings.faq_answer: Aren’t other nutrients important for mamas and mamas-to-be, why just Omega-3 and choline? Many nutrients support fertility, pregnancy, and postpartum recovery. However, Omega-3 and choline are two particularly important nutrients and up to 95% of women are deficient in these nutrients. Omega-3 and choline are also lacking or at very low dosages in most prenatal vitamins. We hope with time that this improves as awareness for these key nutrients grows.

settings.title: I’m not yet pregnant or a mom, is your product still for me?
settings.faq_answer:
Yes, our product is tailored for before, during, and after pregnancy, but it is beneficial at all stages of life. Research suggests that a mom’s habits prior to conception influence her

baby’s well-being not just at birth, but also for its entire lifetime. At every stage of life, the more Omega-3 and choline in your diet, the better you will feel. So, it’s never too early to start a subscription. Men can absolutely take the product and enjoy its benefits, too!

settings.title: Are your products approved by the FDA?
settings.faq_answer: Dietary supplements are regulated like foods, and do not require FDA pre-approval by law, meaning, unlike a drug, the FDA does not formally approve a product before its launch. However, the FDA does regulate both dietary supplements and dietary ingredients. We follow all of the FDA required “current Good Manufacturing Practices” (cGMP)  with are the FDA’s most recent (2007) guidelines for ensuring all products are manufactured to specific requirements including identity, strength, quality, and purity. In addition, we go above and beyond the cGMP quality standards in our ingredient sourcing and quality testing.

settings.title: Why single-serve packets? I hate the extra packaging.
settings.faq_answer: We try to minimize environmental impact wherever we can. However, Omega-3 is highly susceptible to rancidity, and our single-serve packaging is needed to keep our Omega-3 fresh and ready to deliver the biggest benefit you and your baby.

settings.title: Is your packaging recyclable?
settings.faq_answer: Our supplement boxes and shipping boxes are recyclable and compostable (we use soy-based inks). Though we are working to improve this, our packets should currently be disposed in the trash. Our liposomal powder is sensitive to oxygen from the environment, requiring special packaging. We are always looking at ways to increase our sustainability and decrease our environmental impact, from our ingredient sourcing, to our packaging, fulfillment, and more. Please email hello@thisisneeded.com if you have any suggestions.

settings.title: Does your Omega-3 expire?
settings.faq_answer: It is best to consume our product 1-2 hours within opening the packet. Unopened, the product has a shelf life of approximately 1 year.

settings.title: When should I take Omega-3?
settings.faq_answer: You can take our Omega-3 at any time throughout the day. Here at Needed HQ, we most-often mix our Omega-3 into a morning smoothie or a late afternoon latte.

settings.title: Can I take too much Omega-3?
settings.faq_answer: In general, the more Omega-3s in your diet the better you and your baby will feel. However, as a precaution, the FDA recommends taking no more than 3,000mg (3 grams) of Omega-3 a day. In order to exceed that, you would have to consume more than 6 of our packets per day. If you enjoy our product and are tempted to take 6 packets in a day, that’s okay! We just don’t recommend doing so every day.

settings.title: What happens if I miss a day? Or a few days?
settings.faq_answer: Don't sweat it. We know how busy life can get. You can go ahead a double-up on your packets for any days missed. Going forward, we recommend that you try to take your Omega-3 everyday to see positive, long-lasting results.

settings.title: How should I store my Omega-3?
settings.faq_answer: We recommend storing your Omega-3 packets in their box on your countertop (in easy eyesight so you remember to take it every day and away from direct sunlight, or in your pantry or fridge.

settings.title: I eat a lot of Omega-3, why do I need to supplement?
settings.faq_answer:
It is very difficult to get enough Omega-3 DHA + EPA from diet alone. Up to 95% of women are deficient. 

Although there are a lot of plant-based foods that are rich in Omega-3 (walnuts, chia seeds, flax seeds), they have a different type of Omega-3 called ALA. ALA requires conversion by the body into usable forms of Omega-3, DHA, and EPA. This conversion can be quite an inefficient process. 

Fatty fish like salmon or herring is the one reliable food source of DHA and EPA, however many of us do not want to eat fish all the time as it can often come with an environmental price, ingredient and quality trade-offs, or higher levels of heavy metals. 

Our diets often contain a lot of Omega-6, an inflammatory type of fat. Omega-3 and Omega-6 compete in the body, so we often have to take in more Omega-3 to meet our needs.

settings.title: Are your products organic?
settings.faq_answer: Our products are not certified organic, but we source organic ingredients whenever possible.

settings.title: Is your Omega-3 vegan?
settings.faq_answer: Yes. We source our Omega-3 from algae, the primary food source of marine life. And, all other ingredients used in the product are from plants.

settings.title: Are your products nut, gluten, and allergen-free?
settings.faq_answer: Yes. Our manufacturers use a certified cleaning process between production runs, and they test for allergens on their production lines. These measures ensure there is no risk for cross contamination.

settings.title: Are your products GMO-free?
settings.faq_answer: Yes, we are GMO-free.

settings.title: What will my results tell me?
settings.faq_answer: The results provide your Omega-3 Index, a % measure of Omega-3s DHA + EPA in your blood.

settings.title: What is the target range for the Omega-3 Index?
settings.faq_answer: An Omega-3 Index in the range of 8-12% is one indicator of better overall health. An Index of 5% or less (which is common in the US) indicates the highest risk for not having enough Omega-3 for mom or baby in pregnancy.

settings.title: Why should I take this test rather than a blood-draw test ordered by my doctor?
settings.faq_answer: We use a single drop of blood to measure the Omega-3 Index. This eliminates the need to have your blood drawn at a clinic. You can collect your sample and send it through the mail from the comfort of your own home! And, it is highly accurate. Our testing partner, OmegaQuant, has led research on Omega-3 intake for 30 years, and has over 80 published research papers in this field.

settings.title: Does the finger prick hurt?
settings.faq_answer: The prick creates a slight pinch.

settings.title: Are there any risks to testing my Omega-3 levels?
settings.faq_answer:
There is minimal physical risk to you from the finger prick. The prick may cause a small amount of pain and bruising, and the site may bleed slightly for a time after the blood is collected. There is also a very rare chance that the stick site could become infected. If this happens, you might require medical treatment.

There is a very small risk associated with the collection of confidential health information. However, we are making every effort to protect your identity.

settings.title: How long will it take to receive my results?
settings.faq_answer: Your results will be ready within 2 to 3 weeks of our lab receiving your results by mail.

settings.title: How often should I retest my Omega-3 levels?
settings.faq_answer: Once you have begun your new supplementation routine, we suggest waiting at least 4 months before retesting to allow time for your body to replenish its stores of Omega-3.

settings.title: If I am deficient, how long will it take to improve my Omega-3 levels?
settings.faq_answer:
We suggest supplementing with a quality DHA + EPA like our Omega-3 powder right away. You may feel a difference within a couple of weeks, or, it can take a number of months.  While DHA and EPA intake is the primary driver of your Omega-3 Index, your genes, overall health, and lifestyle can affect the Omega-3 Index response to dietary changes. For example, if you are breastfeeding or pregnant, it may take longer to improve your levels as you are still giving so much Omega-3 to baby. 

If your Omega-3 Index level is below 5%, we suggest doubling-up on your dosage by taking two packets of Needed’s Omega-3 per day for a period of several months. It is ideal to re-test your levels after 3-6 months of continuous, daily supplementation when your starting levels are sub-optimal.

settings.title: Is it possible that my Omega-3 levels will be too high?
settings.faq_answer: Whether there is an upper limit of safety for the Index is not clear, but there is likely a value above which there is not likely to be any additional health benefit. We recommend an Omega-3 Index target value of 8-12% because this is where most research indicates a positive effect.  Above 12% has not proven to be disadvantageous, but there is little research for high values. Research suggests up to 95% of women of childbearing age are failing to meet their Omega-3 needs. Of the nearly 250 health-conscious women of childbearing age whose Omega-3 levels we’ve tested thus far, 96% were found to be deficient in DHA+EPA.

settings.title: What is your privacy policy, and how will my results be used by Needed and OmegaQuant?
settings.faq_answer:
The results of your test will be kept strictly confidential.

 

Your results from the test are personal and private.  Records will be kept confidential to the extent provided by federal, state, and local law. Only relevant Needed and OmegaQuant team members will have the right to look at your individual test results and records.

 

Your results will be grouped with the results from other individuals’ tests into a study. Needed and OmegaQuant may share results of this study in marketing, meetings, journals or other forums, but your individual identity will remain secret.

settings.no_articles_text: Can't find what you are looking for? Drop us a note at hello@thisisneeded.com

settings.text:
Whether you're a practitioner, a nutrition nerd, or a curious consumer -- you are welcome here.

Our community celebrates and integrates diverse perspectives. Take a seat, share, listen, and grow with us as we learn from one another what is truly needed for broader nourishment.

settings.title: Brittany Forman
settings.description: Brittany is a nutritionist, community builder, wife, and mother. She is a health coach at Parsley Health and is the founder of CircleMoms. She strives to empower her patients, friends, and family members with the building blocks to successfully optimize their health through nutrition and lifestyle changes. Brittany is passionate about creating an environment for her family that fosters wellness physically, socially, and mentally.

settings.title: Anna Glennon
settings.description: Through her own journey, Anna Glennon learned the debilitating effects of chronic inflammation. Now, she is on a mission to help other women going through similar experiences. As an integrated nutrition health coach, she works with clients to help make lifestyle changes and choose health-promoting habits that produce real and lasting results.

settings.title: Stephanie Greunke
settings.description: Stephanie Greunke is a registered dietician who loves using the principles of naturopathic medicine when working with her clients. Her health plan recommendations not only include dietary recommendations, but fitness, stress and sleep management techniques. She strongly believes in the “food as medicine” approach, but also recognizes the need for intervention at multiple levels. Stephanie understands that one’s diet can be affected by emotional, psychological, and spiritual issues. She fully empathizes with her patients because she has had her own personal health and weight struggles. Instead of dictating the treatment, she works with her patients in a team based approach. Her focus is to empower and educate her patients to become the healthiest version of themselves.

settings.title: Dr. Emily Gutierrez
settings.description: Dr. Gutierrez has an extensive list of credentials - a doctorate from Johns Hopkins University, practitioner certification through the Institute of Functional Medicine, a masters degree from The University of Texas, board certification as a pediatric nurse practitioner and mental health specialist through the Pediatric Nursing Certification Board, and more. Beyond her impressive training, she is also a seasoned speaker, writer, and researcher. In her practice, she incorporates functional nutrition, genetics, immune, and environmental health into providing individualized medical care for her patients. Dr. Gutierrez is a passionate practitioner, delivering outstanding functional and integrative pediatric medical care and direct support to families committed to raising healthy, happy children.

settings.title: Ashley Koch
settings.description: Ashley Koch inspires families to make healthy choices in many facets of their lives that allow children to grow and thrive. She is passionate about providing parents with the tools and support to help their children create lifelong healthy relationships with food. With a focus on individualized plans, she works with families to make nutrition decisions and behavioral shifts that fit into their lives. She finds inspiration all around her - from Northern California grocery stores, to farmers markets, to the pediatrician’s office, to food blogs and cookbooks. She is currently pursuing her masters degree in Functional Medicine and Human Nutrition.

settings.title: Katya Mosely, L. Ac.
settings.description: Katya Mosely, L.Ac. is a California Board licensed acupuncturist, herbalist, and physician of Traditional Chinese Medicine. She practices at Spirit Gate Acupuncture + Wellness, in West Los Angeles, where she focuses on optimizing the health, wellness, and vitality of each adult and child patient.

settings.title: Lauren Rashap, C.C.N.
settings.description: Lauren Rashap is a force of passion when it comes to leading a healthy lifestyle. She is the third generation in her family to study, practice, and teach the art and science of achieving vibrant health through the power of organic foods, yoga, and meditation. Over her decades-long career, Lauren has played vital roles in widespread nutrition philosophies like the Zone Diet, developed one of the first, full-service “traveling spas”, and launched a one-of-a-kind consulting service offering hands-on cooking and nutrition workshops and organic skincare products. She is truly passionate about helping others make transformative changes to lead to more vibrant, happier, and healthier lives.

settings.title: Dr. Elana Roumell
settings.description: When you meet Dr. Elana Roumell, you are immediately drawn to her invigorating energy and authenticity. She is a key contributor and adviser to Needed, providing great insight to product development and formulation. Dr. Elana is a Naturopathic Doctor, driven by a lifelong interest in health, medicine, and alternative options. She is especially passionate about pediatrics, and is committed to helping parents keep their children optimally healthy.

settings.title: Dr. Ari Calhoun
settings.description: Dr. Calhoun is a naturopathic doctor who guides her patients to a state of optimal health through the use of science-based natural therapies. She believes fully in the body’s ability to heal, and recognizes that addressing the root cause, rather than controlling the symptoms, is necessary for complete restoration. She has a special interest in hormone balancing, autoimmune disease, natural approaches to dermatology, and cardio metabolic disease.

settings.title: Nimisha Gandhi
settings.description: Nimisha is a functional medicine nutritionist, certified Ayurvedic counselor, and certified Yoga Nidra teacher. She works mainly with teenage girls and prenatal and postpartum women, focusing on fertility, autoimmune conditions, and rebalancing the gut biome. Nimisha’s approach to mind-body-spirit wellness is deeply influenced by both ancient healing practices and modern medicine.

settings.title: Randi Zinn
settings.description: Randi Zinn is an author, mindfulness and wellness expert, and founder of Beyond Mom. Born from her own experience of motherhood, Beyond Mom is harnessing a movement of women who are taking back their right to self-love, self-care, and community as a pathway to fulfillment. Beyond Mom offers: The Going Beyond Podcast, curated events, speaking engagements, workshops, and retreats for Moms seeking Self.

settings.title: Jess Suchan
settings.description: Jess Suchan coaches her clients towards finding a life of bliss, free from fad diets, overexercising, and burnout. She believes that in order to change our habits, we must address the “holistic picture” and compassionately investigate how all areas of our lives are interconnected. After attending the Institute for Integrative Nutrition, she coaches clients privately and works in partnership with her mom, Candace Burch, who is a hormone health educator. She also leads a virtual group coaching course, hosts events and retreats, and is the creator of the Sexy Sugar Cleanse, a 20 day system reboot for weight release, increased energy levels, and hormone balance.

settings.title: Sapna Fliedner
settings.description:
Sapna Fliedner is a certified Integrative Holistic Health Coach and a firm believer in individualized dietary therapy to help her clients navigate the confusing theories at the forefront of our modern world. Her approach uses real, whole, local and organic foods to prevent and reverse disease, especially in children. 
Originally trained as a Family Nurse Practitioner, she is the co-founder of Raising Sages Integrative Pediatrics in Aliso Viejo, California along with her husband, Dr. Dane Fliedner. She works with children and adults who suffer from allergies, asthma, ADHD, digestive issues.

settings.title: Kelli Tennant
settings.description: Kelli Tennant is the host of the top rated podcast, Ceremony Wellness. Through her own journey healing from chronic illness and trauma, Kelli has curated a space for conversations that cover a wide range of topics in support of women's growth. Her guests, including world-renowned doctors, healers, mentors, speakers, coaches and authors, discuss authenticity, personal development, spirituality, sexuality, plant medicine, using food as medicine, relationships, communication and so much more. Nothing is off the table and everything is aimed at education, awareness and finding your unique truth.

settings.title: Lindsey Vestal
settings.description: Lindsey Vestal owns The Functional Pelvis, a private practice specializing in pelvic floor therapy “house calls” for pre and postnatal women.  She has dedicated her career to empowering women to find relief from conditions such as bowel and urinary incontinence, constipation, dyspareunia, pelvic pain, prolapse and pre and postnatal complications. As an Occupational Therapist, she is a passionate promoter of bridging pelvic floor rehabilitation with lifestyle modifications while addressing the psychological impact that pelvic floor issues have on our everyday lives. She also offers online training courses for occupational therapists interested in pursuing the pelvic health specialty. Lindsey teaches pelvic anatomy and pelvic floor health for the Maha Mama pre- and postnatal yoga teacher training in NYC. She is an ongoing contributor to Well Rounded NY and Motherly. She has published in the NY Times, Family Circle, Romper, NY Mag, Harper’s Bizarre, US News + World Report.

settings.title: Jackie Ganz
settings.description: Jackie found functional medicine through her own health journey. After attending the Functional Medicine Coaching Academy under the Institute for Functional Medicine, she supports her clients privately by helping them make lasting diet and lifestyle changes. She believes that food is medicine and that there is no one size fits all approach. Her passion is helping others feel their best selves by reaching their health goals, increasing their energy, and finding a life of balance.

settings.title: meet our practitioner partners.
settings.sub_title: Our practitioner partners are champions of our community. They serve as product educators and help drive our mission to empower everyone to find real nourishment through nutrition, education, and much more.

settings.title: practitioner partners.
settings.description: Our Practitioner Partners play an integral role in bringing wellness and nourishment to our greater community. Through our partnership, practitioners share their deep knowledge of patients' broader nutritional needs, so we can join together to develop thoughtful product and educational solutions.

settings.section_title: Partner with us.
settings.section_sub_title:
Collaboration is needed. Our growing community of health and wellness practitioners are vital to realizing our mission to bring greater nourishment to everyone. Through these relationships, we build a deep understanding of the nutrition needs practitioners are seeing with their patients and communities. Together, we create thoughtful nutrition products and education to meet these needs.


We offer a Practitioner Partners referral program that rewards practitioners and their communities for prioritizing better nutrition. To learn more, complete the form below. We look forward to meeting you.

settings.title: Start with the Prenatal Multi for an optimal you.
settings.description: Most prenatals meet bare minimum needs. Ours is different.
settings.detail_list:
• Complete selection of vitamins, minerals, and botanicals
  • Optimal nutrient forms
  • Dosages that are truly supportive
  • Easy-to-take powder
  • Expertly-formulated and tested

settings.title: How we prove our products work.
settings.description:
We test and verify every product batch to ensure consistently high quality.

Our ingredients, manufacturing, and finished products are third-party lab tested for safety and efficacy. 

Our products are proven to work in real life, through rigorous testing with our community of health practitioners and real families.

settings.title: Why powder?
settings.answer: Our powdered format enables us to deliver the most nourishing formulation for mamas and mamas-to-be. It’s 5x better absorbed by the body than a standard pill, and is delivered with other needed nutrients that help your body use the Omega-3 DHA and EPA that you and your baby need.

settings.title: What is Omega-3?
settings.answer:
Omega-3 is critical fat for before, during, and after pregnancy. You cannot make Omega-3, and must obtain it from diet or supplementation. There are three main types of Omega-3, ALA, DHA, and EPA. ALA is found in plants like chia seeds, flax seeds, and walnuts. ALA needs to be converted into the DHA and EPA forms of Omega-3 in order to be used by the body. This conversion process is highly inefficient (often less than 1%), so it is important for mom and baby to consume DHA and EPA directly. Fatty fish and supplements are the two reliable dietary sources. Fish do not make the DHA and EPA, but instead bioaccumulate them from eating algae.
DHA is used to build and maintain healthy function of cell membranes throughout the body, including those of the brain, eyes, ovaries, and skin. EPA to produce signaling molecules called eicosanoids, which play numerous physiological roles including supporting mood, hormone balance, and reducing inflammation. EPA also improves the transport of DHA across the placenta.

settings.title: What is a liposome and why is it the optimal way to deliver Omega-3?
settings.answer: Liposomes are molecular structures found in nature, such as in breastmilk. Our liposomes pair Omega-3 with natural helper nutrients, including phospholipids from sunflowers. This pairing 1) facilitates near-perfect (90-95%) Omega-3 absorption, a 5x improvement over a standard pill and 2) protects the Omega-3 from harmful oxidation that leads to rancidity. And, as an extra benefit, the phospholipids are a source of choline, which works synergistically with DHA in the body. Overall, liposomes ensure you and your baby to get more of the DHA and EPA you need.

settings.title: How do I know if I need Omega-3?
settings.answer: Our quiz can help. Many are surprised to find that even if they eat a lot of salmon and sardines, their Omega-3 levels are lower than optimal. Research shows that up to 95% of women are deficient. And, even if you are not deficient, the more Omega-3 in your diet the better you will feel.

settings.title: What does the powder taste and smell like?
settings.answer:
The powder tastes like sunflower lecithin, which has a sweet nutty taste. If you are extra sensitive to taste and smell, you may also detect some algae notes. Most find the taste neutral enough to mix into a variety of food and drinks, including almond milk, smoothies, and lattes.
The powder can often smell stronger than it tastes. If that is the case for you, we suggest letting an open packet sit for a minute or two, take a taste, and then mix it into your food or drink.

settings.title: How should I consume the powder?
settings.answer:
Mix one packet into a single serving of food or drink. Enjoy within 1-2 hours of opening the packets. We do not recommend cooking or baking with the powder. For hot food or drink, please mix once the item is cool enough to consume.
We suggest mixing the powder into lattes, nut butters, salad dressings, and smoothies. Find recipe ideas here .

settings.title: Why is the dosage set at 300mg DHA + 150mg EPA + 55mg choline?
settings.answer:
We set our dosage in partnership with leading scientists and health practitioners across modalities (including MDs, NDs, nutritionists, chinese medicine doctors, midvices, and other birth work professionals) based on research and in-practice experience. Our 300mg of DHA conforms to the American Pregnancy Association per day recommendation. A 2:1 ratio of DHA to EPA allows us to provide multiple benefits for mom and baby, as DHA and EPA have different and often complementary physiological effects. And, as an added benefit to our Omega-3, the powder provides a good source of choline at 55mg.
We recognize that some practitioners recommend higher dosages of Omega-3 for before, during and after pregnancy. Our clinical research suggests that most mamas and mamas-to-be do not need a higher dose than our product delivers, as our powder facilitates near-perfect (90-95%) Omega-3 absorption, a 5x improvement over a standard pill.

settings.title: What kind of testing do you do?
settings.answer: Our powder is expertly formulated and clinically validated by 10+ years of research and development, including through third-party clinical studies. We test every batch for performance and quality, including through third parties that test for nutritional content, 125+ pesticides and herbicides, heavy metals, microbes, allergens, and other contaminants.

settings.title: Everything makes me nauseous while I am pregnant, will your product work for me?
settings.answer: Many pregnant mamas find our product more pleasant to take than a pill, and can often find something palatable to mix the powder into, even while nauseated. We are happy to share ideas, just shoot us a note at hello@thisisneeded.com. However, do not stress if nothing is working for you in your early pregnancy, as baby draws most of the Omega-3 it needs in the third trimester, so you can pause your subscription and restart once your nausea has passed (soon, we hope!)

settings.title: Why should I start a subscription? How does a subscription work?
settings.answer:
Daily, continuous supplementation is needed to maintain optimal Omega-3 levels for you and your baby before, during, and after pregnancy. Our subscription ensures you never miss a day of optimal nourishment. We’ll send you an email each month, a few days before we charge you and ship your next box. You can delay an order, or cancel your subscription at any time, right from your account page.
Your satisfaction is 100% guaranteed. If you aren’t completely satisfied, send us a note at hello@thisisneeded.com and we’ll be happy to help.

settings.title: Aren’t other nutrients important for mamas and mamas-to-be, why just Omega-3 and choline?
settings.answer:
Aren’t other nutrients important for mamas and mamas-to-be, why just Omega-3 and choline?
Many nutrients support fertility, pregnancy, and postpartum recovery. However, Omega-3 and choline are two particularly important nutrients and up to 95% of women are deficient in these nutrients. Omega-3 and choline are also lacking or at very low dosages in most prenatal vitamins. We hope with time that this improves as awareness for these key nutrients grows.

settings.title: I’m not yet pregnant or a mom, is your product still for me?
settings.answer: Yes, our product is tailored for before, during, and after pregnancy, but it is beneficial at all stages of life. Research suggests that a mom’s habits prior to conception influence her baby’s well-being not just at birth, but also for its entire lifetime. At every stage of life, the more Omega-3 and choline in your diet, the better you will feel. So, it’s never too early to start a subscription. Men can absolutely take the product and enjoy its benefits, too!

settings.title: Why single-serve packets? I hate the extra packaging.
settings.answer: We try to minimize environmental impact wherever we can. However, Omega-3 is highly susceptible to rancidity, and our single-serve packaging is needed to keep our Omega-3 fresh and ready to deliver the biggest benefit for you and your baby.

settings.title: Is your packaging recyclable?
settings.answer: Our supplement boxes and shipping boxes are recyclable and compostable (we use soy-based inks). Though we are working to improve this, our packets should currently be disposed in the trash. Our liposomal powder is sensitive to oxygen from the environment, requiring special packaging. We are always looking at ways to increase our sustainability and decrease our environmental impact, from our ingredient sourcing, to our packaging, fulfillment, and more. Please email hello@thisisneeded.com if you have any suggestions.

settings.title: What happens if I miss a day? Or a few days?
settings.answer: Don't sweat it. We know how busy life can get. You can go ahead a double-up on your packets for any days missed. Going forward, we recommend that you try to take your Omega-3 everyday to see positive, long-lasting results.

settings.heading: Why test your levels
settings.description:
Up to 95% of women are deficient in Omega-3, and levels are often halved during pregnancy. An Omega-3 deficiency during pregnancy can lead to increased risk of pre-term labor. Postpartum Omega-3 deficiency can persist for years after pregnancy, impacting mama’s breastmilk DHA levels, brain function, mood and hormone balances, fertility, postpartum recovery, and more.
Testing your levels empowers you to better understand your unique Omega-3 needs, as a first step in optimizing you and your baby’s wellbeing.

settings.section_title: How it works
settings.section_subtitle: Our simple and safe blood collection method does not require a full blood draw or a trip to the doctor. One drop of blood from a finger prick is all that's needed to assess your Omega-3 status.

settings.item_desc: Omega-3 levels start changing as soon as you change your diet and supplementation routine, and stabilize in 3-4 months.

settings.section_title: We've partnered with the leading experts on Omega-3 nutrient testing, OmegaQuant.
settings.section_desc: OmegaQuant is an independent, CLIA-certified lab that offers Omega-3 Index testing to researchers, clinicians and the public and sets the standard for Omega-3 testing.
settings.section_bottom_text: Read more about why we partnered with OmegaQuant.

settings.title: What's included with the test?
settings.answer: The test kit includes a blood collection card, lancet, alcohol pad, gauze pad, bandage, and a prepaid return envelope. See here.

settings.title: What will my results tell me?
settings.answer: The results provide your Omega-3 Index, a % measure of Omega-3s DHA + EPA in your blood.

settings.title: What is the target range for the Omega-3 Index?
settings.answer: An Omega-3 Index in the range of 8-12% is one indicator of better overall health. An Index of 5% or less (which is common in the US) indicates the highest risk for not having enough Omega-3 for mom or baby in pregnancy.

settings.title: Why should I take this test rather than a blood-draw test ordered by my doctor?
settings.answer: We use a single drop of blood to measure the Omega-3 Index. This eliminates the need to have your blood drawn at a clinic. You can collect your sample and send it through the mail from the comfort of your own home! And, it is highly accurate. Our testing partner, OmegaQuant, has led research on Omega-3 intake for 30 years, and has over 80 published research papers in this field.

settings.title: Does the finger prick hurt?
settings.answer: The prick creates a slight pinch.

settings.title: Are there any risks to testing my Omega-3 levels?
settings.answer:
There is minimal physical risk to you from the finger prick. The prick may cause a small amount of pain and bruising, and the site may bleed slightly for a time after the blood is collected. There is also a very rare chance that the stick site could become infected. If this happens, you might require medical treatment.

There is a very small risk associated with the collection of confidential health information. However, we are making every effort to protect your identity.

settings.title: How long will it take to receive my results?
settings.answer: Your results will be ready within 2 to 3 weeks of our lab receiving your results by mail.

settings.title: How often should I re-rest my Omega-3 levels?
settings.answer: Once you have begun your new supplementation routine, we suggest waiting at least 4 months before retesting to allow time for your body to replenish its stores of Omega-3.

settings.title: If I am deficient, how long will it take to improve my Omega-3 levels?
settings.answer:
We suggest supplementing with a quality DHA + EPA like our Omega-3 powder right away. You may feel a difference within a couple of weeks, or, it can take a number of months. While DHA and EPA intake is the primary driver of your Omega-3 Index, your genes, overall health, and lifestyle can affect the Omega-3 Index response to dietary changes. For example, if you are breastfeeding or pregnant, it may take longer to improve your levels as you are still giving so much Omega-3 to baby.

If your Omega-3 Index level is below 5%, we suggest doubling-up on your dosage by taking two packets of Needed’s Omega-3 per day for a period of several months. It is ideal to re-test your levels after 3-6 months of continuous, daily supplementation when your starting levels are sub-optimal.

settings.title: Is it possible that my Omega-3 levels will be too high?
settings.answer: Whether there is an upper limit of safety for the Index is not clear, but there is likely a value above which there is not likely to be any additional health benefit. We recommend an Omega-3 Index target value of 8-12% because this is where most research indicates a positive effect.  Above 12% has not proven to be disadvantageous, but there is little research for high values. Research suggests up to 95% of women of childbearing age are failing to meet their Omega-3 needs. Of the nearly 250 health-conscious women of childbearing age whose Omega-3 levels we’ve tested thus far, 96% were found to be deficient in DHA+EPA.

settings.title: What is your privacy policy, and how will my results be used by Needed and OmegaQuant?
settings.answer:
The results of your test will be kept strictly confidential.

Your results from the test are personal and private. Records will be kept confidential to the extent provided by federal, state, and local law. Only relevant Needed and OmegaQuant team members will have the right to look at your individual test results and records.

Your results will be grouped with the results from other individuals’ tests into a study. Needed and OmegaQuant may share results of this study in marketing, meetings, journals or other forums, but your individual identity will remain secret.

settings.title: Our products are both natural and clinically-validated.
settings.description: Our products are inspired by nature, informed by science, and tailored to your needs. We are committed to proving our products work, both in the lab through clinical-validation and third-party testing, as well as in the real lives of our customers and health practitioner community.

settings.title: How we ensure we deliver the best nutrition
settings.sub_heading: we pair nutrients found together in nature-that context matters for absorption and optimal usability.
settings.thumb_title_4: Expertly-formulated, with over 10+ years of R&D

settings.content: Liposomes are molecular structures found in nature, such as in breastmilk, that facilitate nutrient absorption and protection. They allow us to deliver an Omega-3 that’s 5x better absorbed by the body than a standard pill, along with other needed nutrients, like choline, that help your body use the Omega-3 DHA and EPA that you and your baby need. In addition, liposomes protect our Omega-3 from harmful oxidation that leads to rancidity.

Liposomes are spherical molecular structures found in nature comprised of phospholipids, a type of fat present in all cells of the body. Liposomes facilitate near-perfect nutrient absorption and protection. In our liposomes, individual molecules of the fat-soluble nutrient Omega-3 are dispersed within a single bilayer of phospholipids, sitting within one molecular width from the surface of the liposome. The structure, in size and molecular arrangement, mimics that of naturally occurring liposomes, such as in breastmilk. In this form, the body recognizes the nutrients as “ready” to enter the final stages of digestion and nutrient absorption, bypassing the multi-stage (and often incomplete) interaction with intestinal fluids that is otherwise needed to break down and repackage nutrients prior to absorption. The liposomes allow us to deliver an Omega-3 that’s 5x better absorbed by the body than a standard pill. In addition, our phospholipids are derived from sunflower lecithin, which breaks down into choline, a key nutrient which supports optimal utilization of Omega 3- DHA and EPA within the body. Our liposomes also protect the Omega-3 from harmful oxidation that leads to rancidity in many other Omega-3 supplements. Overall, our liposomes ensure you and your baby to get more of the nutrients you need.
Really want to dig-into liposomes? Read our deep-dive here, and the results of our clinical study here.

settings.heading: Liposomes-why nature selects them for optimal nutrient delivery.
Proven absorption that rivals nature.
settings.sub_heading: Our liposomal Omega-3 is clinically-proven to be 5x better absorbed than standard fish oil pills.
settings.description: A recently completed long chain fatty acid plasma PK study with Huntington Medical Research Institute evaluated the absorption benefits of Needed’s liposomes against triglyceride gel caps. Both the liposomes and the gel caps contained Omega-3 DHA and EPA triglycerides from algae (i.e. where fish naturally get their DHA and EPA). The study also compared the absorption of DHA and EPA from the liposomes against published norms for DHA and EPA uptake from whole oily fish and ethyl ester gel gaps.

settings.heading: Our expert partners
settings.sub_heading: We’ve partnered with the leading experts on natural nutrient delivery to create our liposomal products. Our expert team of researchers and biochemists have over 40+ years of experience in replicating nature’s optimal nutrient delivery method.
settings.mem_1_desc: Crispin is a research scientist and entrepreneur, focusing his efforts on product development for commercially viable liposomal formulations. Alongside Needed, Crispin is realizing his dream of harnessing the power of liposomes to deliver natural ingredients to improve women’s and family health. Crispin holds both a B.A. (honors) and a Ph.D. in Chemistry from Oxford University.
settings.mem_2_desc:
Professor Baldeschwieler is a J. S. Johnson Professor of Chemistry, Emeritus at California Institute of Technology beginning his tenure there in 1973. He is a National Medal of Science recipient for his public service and scientific contributions, and worked as Deputy Director of the Office of Science and Technology in The White House from 1970-1972. Professor Baldeschwieler has dedicated his career to the study and applicability of natural delivery systems, namely liposomal technology.

While at Caltech, he was responsible for commercializing some of the first and most successful pharmaceutical liposomal applications. He founded Vestar, Inc. and served as the Chairman of its Board of Directors before it merged into NeXstar Pharmaceuticals, Inc. (acquired by Gilead, Inc.). He founded other companies, such as Combion, and served as Director of the Huntington Medical Research Institutes. He taught at Harvard and Stanford before joining the faculty at Caltech. Professor Baldeschwieler completed his undergraduate studies in Chemical Engineering at Cornell University and earned a Ph.D. in Chemistry from University of California, Berkeley.
settings.btm_title: We further substantiate our products through our network of trusted health practitioners

settings.title: Needed+OmegaQuant Omega-3 Testing of Healthy Women of Childbearing Age
settings.answer: Needed, in partnership with OmegaQuant, the leading experts on Omega-3 DHA and EPA nutrient testing, tested the Omega-3 status of 241 nutritionally-aware women of childbearing age, and found that 96.3% were not meeting their Omega-3 needs (Omega-3 index <8%), and 41.9% were critically low in Omega-3 (Omega-3 index <5%), as of the testing date. This testing was conducted over 6 months with participants from across the country, including integrative doctors, doulas, acupuncturists, nutritionists, and other health-minded women who attended wellness events including Attune in Georgia, Ceremony Wellness in Los Angeles, In Good Company in San Francisco, and the DONA International Doula Conference in Houston. Read the full testing results here.

settings.title: Dietary Intakes of EPA and DHA Omega-3 Fatty Acids among US Childbearing-Age and Pregnant Women: An Analysis of NHANES 2001-2014
settings.answer: Researchers reviewed National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES) data from cycles 2001–2002 through 2013–2014 to determine trends in EPA and DHA intakes among childbearing-age and pregnant women including usual intakes and percentage not meeting recommended intakes from The 2015–2020 Dietary Guidelines for Americans (DGA). It was estimated that over 95% of women of childbearing-age did not meet the recommended daily intakes of 250 mg EPA and DHA through seafood or supplementation. Similar results were observed for pregnant women. Read the full study and abstract here.

settings.title: Omega‐3 Fatty Acid Addition During Pregnancy
settings.answer: In an updated Cochrane systematic review, researchers combined all published randomized controlled trials investigating the effect of Omega-3 long-chain fats during pregnancy on outcomes for mothers and babies. A total of 70 randomised controlled trials, involving almost 20,000 women, were included in the review. The review found that supplementation with Omega-3 during pregnancy: 1) lowers the risk of having a preterm baby <37 weeks’ by 11% (from 134 per 1,000 to 119 per 1,000 births) 2) lowers the risk of having an early preterm baby <34 weeks’ by 42% (from 46 per 1,000 to 27 per 1,000 births), and 3) reduces the risk of having a low birth weight baby <2,500g by 10% (from 156 per 1,000 to 140 per 1,000 births). Read the full study and abstract here.

settings.title: Omega-3 Fatty Acid Supplementation During Pregnancy
settings.answer: Researchers from Obstetrics & Gynecology reviewed literature to present information about how the absolute and relative concentrations of omega-3 fatty acids affect pregnancy outcome and fetal neurodevelopment. They eloquently summarize the importance of DHA and EPA and their role in pregnancy. Read the full study and abstract here.

settings.title: Importance of a Balanced Omega-6/Omega-3 Ratio for the Maintenance of Health
settings.answer: Researchers examined changes in dietary patterns that have led to reduced consumption of Omega-3 fatty acids and the importance of the Omega-6 / Omega-3 balance in maintaining good health. In addition, the researchers reviewed the established recommendations for preventing a poor intake of Omega-3, and possible options for compensating the lack of Omega-3 in the current diet. The researchers found that most studies indicate that the Omega-3 / Omega-6 ratio should be lower than that presently found in the general population and stressed the importance of promoting nutritional education programs that stress the need to increase the consumption of Omega-3. Read the full study and abstract here.

settings.title: Dietary (n-3) Fatty acids and Brain Development
settings.answer: Published in the Journal of Nutrition, a researcher reviewed recent studies on the role of DHA in brain development and function shedding additional light on the processes by which DHA is incorporated into a rapidly developing brain in utero and where DHA supports the formation of neurons and protects the brain from inflammation and damage, in infants and children, as well as at other stages of the lifespan. Read the full study and abstract here.

settings.title: High levels of anti-inflammatory and pro-resolving lipid mediators lipoxins and resolvins and declining docosahexaenoic acid levels in human milk during the first month of lactation
settings.answer: Researchers evaluated the composition of 94 human milk samples from 30 mothers over the first month of lactation. Data from the study suggests that DHA levels in the milk can decline by up to half in just the first month of nursing. Read the full study and abstract here.

settings.title: A Prenatal DHA Test to Help Identify Women at Increased Risk for Early Preterm Birth: A Proposal
settings.answer: Researchers summarize the evidence linking blood DHA levels with the risk for preterm birth. They propose that women who are pregnant or trying to become pregnant build a red blood cell (RBC) DHA value of at least 5% (of total RBC fatty acids). In the US, ~70% of women of childbearing age are likely below this 5% cut-off point. Read the full study and abstract here.

settings.title: Effect of prenatal EPA and DHA on maternal and umbilical cord blood cytokines
settings.answer:
Researchers performed this study to investigate the effect of prenatal eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA)- and docosahexaenoic acid (DHA)- rich fish oil supplementation on maternal and fetal cytokine production, an indicator of inflammation associated with many complications in pregnancy. They enrolled 126 women, of whom 118 completed the trial. Prenatal supplementation with EPA-rich fish oil significantly lowered certain maternal cytokine concentrations. However, supplementation with DHA-rich fish oil had no significant effect on maternal cytokine profiles. Neither had an effect on umbilical cord blood cytokine concentrations. Read the full study and abstract here.
